class.name: ConcaveMeshShape3D
class.brief_description: Concave mesh shape resource (also called "trimesh") for 3D physics.
class.description: 3D concave mesh shape resource (also called "trimesh") to be added as a [i]direct[/i] child of a [PhysicsBody3D] or [Area3D] using a [CollisionShape3D] node. This shape is created by feeding a mesh. Despite its name, [ConcaveMeshShape3D] can also store convex mesh shapes. However, unlike [ConvexMeshShape3D], [ConcaveMeshShape3D] is [i]not[/i] limited to storing convex shapes exclusively. [b]Note:[/b] When used for collision, [ConcaveMeshShape3D] is intended to work with static [PhysicsBody3D] nodes like [StaticBody3D] and will not work with [CharacterBody3D] or [RigidBody3D] with a mode other than Static. [b]Performance:[/b] Due to its complexity, [ConcaveMeshShape3D] is the slowest collision shape to check collisions against. Its use should generally be limited to level geometry. For convex geometry, using [ConvexMeshShape3D] will perform better. For dynamic physics bodies that need concave collision, several [ConvexMeshShape3D]s can be used to represent its collision by using convex decomposition; see [ConvexMeshShape3D]'s documentation for instructions. However, consider using primitive collision shapes such as [SphereShape3D] or [BoxShape3D] first. [b]Warning:[/b] Using this shape for an [Area3D] may give unexpected results: the area will only detect collisions with the triangle faces in the [ConcaveMeshShape3D] (and not with any "inside" of the shape, for example); moreover it will only detect all such collisions if [member backface_collision] is [code]true[/code].

method.name: get_faces
method.description: Returns the faces (an array of triangles).

method.name: set_faces
method.description: Sets the faces (an array of triangles).

members.member: If set to [code]true[/code], collisions occur on both sides of the concave shape faces. Otherwise they occur only along the face normals.
The mesh used to create the concave polygon shape.
